content:
Hey, I've opened an issue about whitepaper in ethereum/ethereum-org-website and they said I should ask the question in there. Because they want to keep whitepaper original. But I think there is a mistake in whitepaper.

Whitepaper says:

> If the value transfer failed because the sender did not have enough money, or the code execution ran out of gas, revert all state changes except the payment of the fees, and add the fees to the miner's account.

But AFAIK also the sender's nonce changes if there is an out of gas situation. I tested it, and I am right. Am I missing something or there is misinformation?
